title: Get Started
code: # create a directory for results, currently set to tempdir() # save_dir <- "/Users/hungm/Documents/development/deseq2pip/tests/rnaseq/pipeline/" save_dir <- tempdir() dir.create(save_dir, recursive = TRUE) ## Warning in dir.create(save_dir, recursive = TRUE): '/tmp/RtmpY4tAB6' already ## exists

what: Load DESeq2 object from nfcore pipeline
title: Get Started
code: # load example DESeq2 object rdata <- system.file("data", "GSE189410.dds.RData", package = "deseq2pip") tx2gene <- gzfile(system.file("data", "GSE189410.tx2gene.tsv.gz", package = "deseq2pip")) dds <- import_nfcore_rna(rdata = rdata, tx2gene = tx2gene) assay(dds)[1:5, 1:5] ##               BM_IgA_1 BM_IgA_2 BM_IgA_3 BM_IgA_4 BM_IgG_1 ## 0610005C13Rik       18        8       18       11       12 ## 0610006L08Rik        0        0       11        0        0 ## 0610009B22Rik      102       93      124      128      126 ## 0610009E02Rik       50       11       22       13       21 ## 0610009L18Rik        5       10        3        4        3

what: Set group variable to compare between
title: Get Started
code: # set group variable to compare between, with the first level set as the reference dds$Group2 <- factor(dds$Group2, c('IgM', 'IgG', 'IgA'))  # set dds design with desired variables design(dds) <- ~ Group2

title: Get Started
code: # create a directory for results, currently set to tempdir() # save_dir <- "/Users/hungm/Documents/development/deseq2pip/tests/atacseq/pipeline/" save_dir <- tempdir() dir.create(save_dir, recursive = TRUE) ## Warning in dir.create(save_dir, recursive = TRUE): '/tmp/RtmpY4tAB6' already ## exists

what: Load DESeq2 object from nfcore pipeline
title: Get Started
code: # load example DESeq2 object rdata <- system.file("data", "GSE224512.dds.RData", package = "deseq2pip") annotatePeaks <- gzfile(system.file("data", "GSE224512.annotatePeaks.txt.gz", package = "deseq2pip")) dds <- import_nfcore_atac(rdata = rdata, annotatePeaks = annotatePeaks) assay(dds)[1:5, 1:5] ##            CC_REP3 CB_REP1 CC_REP4 CC_REP1 CC_REP2 ## Interval_1      13       9      12      14      18 ## Interval_2      16      13      11      15      10 ## Interval_3      16       9      14       9      15 ## Interval_4       7      16      17      20      16 ## Interval_5       3       4       4       6       6 # subset groups for brevity dds <- dds[, dds$Group1 %in% c("WT", 'BC', 'BCK')]

what: Set group variable to compare between
title: Get Started
code: # set group variable to compare between, with the first level set as the reference dds$Group1 <- factor(dds$Group1, c("WT", 'BC', 'BCK'))  # set dds design with desired variables design(dds) <- ~ Group1

what: Create gene set collections for run_gsea()
title: Build GSEA Gene Set Collections
code: # create gene set collections for human and mouse collection_name <- c("HALLMARK", "GOBP", "KEGG", "REACTOME", "BIOCARTA", "TFT") for(i in c("hs_gs", "mm_gs")){     if(i == "hs_gs"){         org = "Homo sapiens"}     else if(i == "mm_gs"){         org = "Mus musculus"}     gs <- list()      # c1 gene set     HM<-msigdbr(species = org, category ="H")     gs[[1]] <- HM %>% dplyr::select(., gs_name, gene_symbol) %>% mutate(collection = collection_name[1])      # c5 gene set     GO<-msigdbr(species = org, category ="C5")     gs[[2]] <-GO %>% dplyr::select(., gs_name, gene_symbol) %>% filter(stringr::str_detect(gs_name, 'GOBP')) %>% mutate(collection = collection_name[2])      # c2 gene set     C2<-msigdbr(species = org, category ="C2")     gs[[3]] <-C2 %>% dplyr::select(., gs_name, gene_symbol) %>% filter(stringr::str_detect(gs_name, 'KEGG')) %>% mutate(collection = collection_name[3])     gs[[4]] <-C2 %>% dplyr::select(., gs_name, gene_symbol) %>% filter(stringr::str_detect(gs_name, 'REACTOME')) %>% mutate(collection = collection_name[4])     gs[[5]] <-C2 %>% dplyr::select(., gs_name, gene_symbol) %>% filter(stringr::str_detect(gs_name, 'BIOCARTA')) %>% mutate(collection = collection_name[5])      # c3 gene set     TFT <-msigdbr(species = org, category ="C3")     gs[[6]] <-TFT %>% dplyr::select(., gs_name, gene_symbol) %>% mutate(collection = collection_name[6])      gs <- bind_rows(gs)     assign(i, gs)} ## title: Advance Guide
text: Let’s import prepare data. ’ll use example dataset GSE189410 demonstrate workflow:
code: # load example DESeq2 object rdata <- system.file("data", "GSE189410.dds.RData", package = "deseq2pip") tx2gene <- gzfile(system.file("data", "GSE189410.tx2gene.tsv.gz", package = "deseq2pip")) dds <- import_nfcore_rna(rdata = rdata, tx2gene = tx2gene) assay(dds)[1:5, 1:5] ##               BM_IgA_1 BM_IgA_2 BM_IgA_3 BM_IgA_4 BM_IgG_1 ## 0610005C13Rik       18        8       18       11       12 ## 0610006L08Rik        0        0       11        0        0 ## 0610009B22Rik      102       93      124      128      126 ## 0610009E02Rik       50       11       22       13       21 ## 0610009L18Rik        5       10        3        4        3 # set group variable to compare between, with the first level set as the reference dds$Group2 <- factor(dds$Group2, c('IgM', 'IgG', 'IgA'))  # set dds design with desired variables # for more information about setting contrasts in DESeq2, see: https://github.com/tavareshugo/tutorial_DESeq2_contrasts?tab=readme-ov-file design(dds) <- ~ Group2

title: Advance Guide
text: run_deseq2_pip() function wrapper function runs complete RNA-seq analysis every comparison pair specified group variable. analysis comparison pair can broken three modules: Quality Control: Filters genes, generates QC/PCA/distance plots, saves expression data Differential Expression Analysis: Performs DESeq2 analysis, functional gene annotation, creates volcano plots GSEA Analysis: Find enriched pathways using MSigDB collections prepare results EnrichmentMap visualization example dataset, hqf3 3 comparison pairs group variable Group2: IgM vs IgG, IgM vs IgA, IgG vs IgA. ’s run complete pipeline single command: Note: Repeating run_deseq2_pip overwrite existing files directory name used. prevent , please specify different save_dir directory. create directory structure specified save directory: * qc_results/ contains QC plots expression data * batch_corrected/ contains batch corrected plots expression data * Group2/ contains directories comparison pair comparison pair, directory contains: * diffexp_deseq2_wald.tsv: Dataframe differential expression results gene annotation * diffexp_volcano.pdf: Volcano plot differential expression results * outputs gene set collection (HALLMARK, GOBP, KEGG, REACTOME, TFT, BIOCARTA): * gsea_.rds: RDS file gseaResult class object  gsea_.tsv: TSV file GSEA results  gsea_*_barplot.pdf: Barplots top N terms GSEA results
code: # run deseq2 pipeline #run_deseq2_pip(dds, experiment = "GSE189410", org = "mouse", group_by = "Group2", remove_xy = TRUE, remove_mt = TRUE, save_dir = "/Users/hungm/Documents/development/deseq2pip/tests/pipeline/") # show directory structure #fs::dir_tree("/Users/hungm/Documents/development/deseq2pip/tests/pipeline/", recurse = 1) # show directory structure for a specific comparison pair #fs::dir_tree("/Users/hungm/Documents/development/deseq2pip/tests/pipeline/Group2/IgA_vs_IgG/")

title: Advance Guide
text: initial run DESeq2 pipeline, may wish run specific module using different parameters comparison groups without repeating entire pipeline. ’s run module separately. breakdown list processes performed module.
code: # set global arguments # save_dir <- "/Users/hungm/Documents/development/deseq2pip/tests/rnaseq/module/" save_dir <- tempdir() dir.create(save_dir, recursive = TRUE) ## Warning in dir.create(save_dir, recursive = TRUE): '/tmp/RtmpPsoSjf' already ## exists group_by <- "Group2" batch <- NULL org <- "mouse" group_dir <- paste0(save_dir, "/", group_by, "/")  # Module 1: Quality Control #dds <- run_qc_pip(dds, experiment = "GSE189410", org = org, group_by = group_by, remove_xy = T, remove_mt = T, save_dir = save_dir) #dds <- run_dist_pip(dds, experiment = "GSE189410", group_by = group_by, batch = batch, save_dir = save_dir)  # Module 2: Differential Expression Analysis #res <- run_diffexp_pip(dds, org = org, group_by = group_by, save_dir = group_dir)  # Module 3: GSEA Analysis #run_gsea_pip(res = res, org = org, save_dir = group_dir)

title: Advance Guide
text: run_qc_pip() module contains sequence subprocesses performs quality control checks data.

title: Advance Guide
text: data contains samples taken males females interested , can optionally remove gender-specific genes X Y chromosomes. can done remove_xy_genes() function. optional recommended see gender-specific effect downstream PCA distance analysis. Similarly, data contains mitochondrial genes interested , can optionally remove remove_mt_genes() function.
code: # remove XY genes (Optional) dds <- remove_xy_genes(dds, org = "mouse") ## Removing XY genes... dds ## class: DESeqDataSet  ## dim: 53584 11  ## metadata(1): version ## assays(1): counts ## rownames(53584): 0610005C13Rik 0610006L08Rik ... snoZ159 snoZ196 ## rowData names(0): ## colnames(11): BM_IgA_1 BM_IgA_2 ... BM_IgM_3 BM_IgM_4 ## colData names(6): sample Group1 ... sizeFactor condition # remove MT genes (Optional) dds <- remove_mt_genes(dds, org = "mouse") ## Removing MT genes... any(str_detect(rownames(dds), "^[Mm][Tt]-")) ## [1] TRUE dds ## class: DESeqDataSet  ## dim: 53571 11  ## metadata(1): version ## assays(1): counts ## rownames(53571): 0610005C13Rik 0610006L08Rik ... snoZ159 snoZ196 ## rowData names(0): ## colnames(11): BM_IgA_1 BM_IgA_2 ... BM_IgM_3 BM_IgM_4 ## colData names(6): sample Group1 ... sizeFactor condition

title: Advance Guide
text: RNA-seq high-throughput technology can noisy, certain genes poorly captured RNA-seq. control , remove genes improve statistical power subsequent analysis. default keep genes least 5% total expression (remove_low_expression(..., quantile = 0.05)). gene must also expressed least n replicates, n minimum replicates group.
code: # remove low expression genes dds <- remove_low_expression(dds, quantile = 0.05, group_by = "Group2", save_plot = FALSE) ## Filtering genes with low expressions...

title: Advance Guide
text: Expression genes may vary samples, may due sample/batch quality issues. draw boxplot representing expression level every gene compare gene expression distribution sample using check_library() function. boxplots show little variation expression level across samples, indicates samples high quality suitable differential expression analysis. Otherwise, one consider removing samples low quality perform batch correction downstream address quality issues. address technical variation samples/batches improve statistical power true biological variations.
code: # check library size distribution check_library(dds, save_plot = FALSE)

title: Advance Guide
text: Next visualize relationship samples/groups using PCA distance analysis using run_pca() run_distance() functions. true biological variability groups, replicas group cluster closely PCA plot lower distance values distance heatmap. , one consider sample/batch quality samples separate expected.
code: # run PCA for the samples with group information vsd <- vst(dds, blind = FALSE) run_pca(vsd, group_by = "Group2", size = 4, save_data = FALSE, save_plot = FALSE) ## using ntop=500 top features by variance # run distance analysis between samples run_distance(vsd, save_data = FALSE, save_plot = FALSE)

title: Advance Guide
text: run_diffexp_pip() module performs statistical analysis identify differentially expressed genes groups using DESeq2::DESeq2() function, p-values generated using Wald test.

title: Advance Guide
text: main function module run_diffexp_list() function, default perform pairwise comparisons groups DESeq2 object. returns single dataframe metrics DESeq2::results(), differentially expressed genes comparison separated comparison column. Additionally, chromosome loci functional annotations gene added dataframe using strpip::run_annotation() function (see https://github.com/hungms/strpip).

title: Advance Guide
text: module also includes plot_ma_list() function, wrapper plot_ma() command generate MA plots comparisons. use plot_ma() generate single MA plot IgA_vs_IgG comparison demonstration.
code: # generate MA plot for all comparisons; skipped here #plot_ma_list(res, save_plot = FALSE)  # Generate MA plot for the "IgA_vs_IgG" comparison res.IgA_vs_IgG <- res %>% filter(comparison == "IgA_vs_IgG") plot_ma(res.IgA_vs_IgG, save_plot = FALSE) ## Warning: ggrepel: 1096 unlabeled data points (too many overlaps). Consider ## increasing max.overlaps

title: Advance Guide
text: final run_gsea_pip() module performs gene set enrichment analysis identify biological pathways processes using list MSigDB gene set collections (HALLMARK, GOBP, KEGG, REACTOME, TFT, BIOCARTA). Gene sets must least 10 1000 genes tested.

text: module also includes plot_gsea_barplot_list() function, wrapper plot_gsea_barplot() command generate barplots comparisons. use plot_gsea_barplot() generate single barplot IgA_vs_IgG comparison using GOBP collection demonstration. default, barplot show top 10 upregulated downregulated terms.
code: # generate barplot for all comparisons; skipped here #plot_gsea_barplot_list(gsea.df, save_plot = FALSE)  # Generate barplot for the "IgA_vs_IgG" comparison plot_gsea_barplot(gsea.IgA_vs_IgG.gobp, n = 10, save_plot = FALSE) ## Warning in geom_col(aes(stroke = label), width = 0.75, col = "black"): ## Ignoring unknown aesthetics: stroke

code: @Manual{,   title = {deseq2pip: DESeq2 Pipeline for RNA-seq Analysis},   author = {Miu Shing Hung},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.1},   url = {https://hungms.github.io/deseq2pip/}, }

title: DESeq2 Pipeline for RNA-seq Analysis
text: deseq2pip comprehensive R package streamlines RNA-seq data analysis combining DESeq2-based differential expression analysis downstream functional analysis visualization. package provides modular yet integrated workflow quality control, differential expression analysis, gene set enrichment analysis, visualization results.

title: DESeq2 Pipeline for RNA-seq Analysis
text: detailed usage documentation functions, please visit latest documentation.

title: DESeq2 Pipeline for RNA-seq Analysis
text: Quality control data preparation Differential expression analysis Functional enrichment analysis Visualization results Filtering lowly expressed genes Options remove sex chromosome genes mitochondrial genes Quality control plots (PCA, sample distance) Automated pairwise comparisons experimental groups Integrated DESeq2 workflow convenient parameter settings Comprehensive result tables gene-level functional annotation Gene set enrichment analysis (GSEA) using MSigDB gene sets Support human mouse organisms Customizable ranking metrics significance thresholds Publication-ready volcano plots Customizable gene expression plots GSEA barplots pathway visualization Support output formatting Cytoscape EnrichmentMap

title: DESeq2 Pipeline for RNA-seq Analysis
code: # Install devtools if not already installed if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("devtools") }  # Install deseq2pip from GitHub devtools::install_github("hungms/deseq2pip")

title: DESeq2 Pipeline for RNA-seq Analysis
text: package relies several Bioconductor packages:
code: # Install BiocManager if not already installed if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("BiocManager") }  # Install required Bioconductor packages BiocManager::install(c("DESeq2", "clusterProfiler", "msigdbr", "biomaRt"))

title: DESeq2 Pipeline for RNA-seq Analysis
code: library(deseq2pip)  # load example DESeq2 object rdata <- system.file("data", "GSE189410.Rdata", package = "deseq2pip") tx2gene <- system.file("data", "GSE189410_tx2gene.tsv", package = "deseq2pip") dds <- import_nfcore_dds(rdata = rdata, tx2gene = tx2gene)  # set group variable to compare between, with the first level set as the reference dds$Group2 <- factor(dds$Group2, c('IgM', 'IgG', 'IgA'))  # set dds design with desired variables design(dds) <- ~ Group2  # Set directory to store results save_dir <- "/Users/hungm/Documents/development/deseq2pip/tests/pipeline/"  # Run the complete pipeline run_deseq2_pip(     dds,     assaytype = "RNA",     experiment = "GSE189410",     remove_xy = TRUE,     remove_mt = TRUE,     org = "mouse",     group_by = "Group2",     save_dir = save_dir)  # See output directory structure list.dir(save_dir)

title: Run Complete DESeq2 Pipeline — run_deseq2_pip

code: run_deseq2_pip(   dds,   experiment,   batch = NULL,   save_dir = getwd(),   org = "human",   remove_xy = FALSE,   remove_mt = FALSE,   group_by = "Group1",   quantile = 0.05,   order = "rank",   save_dir_name = "qc_results",   assaytype = "RNA" )

title: Run Complete DESeq2 Pipeline — run_deseq2_pip
text: dds DESeq2 object containing expression data experiment Name experiment batch Column name colData(dds) use batch correction. Default NULL save_dir Directory output files saved. Default current working directory org organism use, either "human" "mouse". Default "human" remove_xy Logical. TRUE, removes genes X Y chromosomes. Default FALSE remove_mt Logical. TRUE, removes mitochondrial genes. Default FALSE group_by Column name colData(dds) use grouping. Default "Group1" quantile Quantile threshold filtering lowly expressed genes. Default 0.05 order Column name use ranking genes. Default "rank" save_dir_name Name subdirectory save files . Default "qc_results" assaytype Type assay, either "RNA" "ATAC". Default "RNA"

title: Run Complete DESeq2 Pipeline — run_deseq2_pip
text: processed DESeq2 object

title: Run Complete DESeq2 Pipeline — run_deseq2_pip
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Run complete pipeline with default settings dds <- run_deseq2_pip(dds, experiment = "my_experiment")  # Run pipeline with custom settings dds <- run_deseq2_pip(dds, experiment = "my_experiment",                     org = "mouse", remove_xy = TRUE,                     group_by = "Treatment",                     save_dir_name = "custom_results")  # Run pipeline with batch correction dds <- run_deseq2_pip(dds, experiment = "my_experiment",                     batch = "Batch") } # }
